title: I get a higher ping with spikes at night time but it goes down at about 1am.
body:
The only time i really have to play is in the afternoons/nights but im always stuck with about a 120ms ping which is alright but it spikes quite a lot and is not a condition to play in. I sometimes check at 1am and the ping is down to 32 but I can hardly play at that time. Please let me know of any possible fixes. 
Thanks in advance.

replies.body:
That could be due to the on-peak and off-peak traffic of the network you're on. Contact your ISP and ask them what they consider to be "on-peak" and "off-peak", so that you can at least confirm it.

Speaking of which, what OS are you on, and which ISP are you with?

Windows 7 Home Premium and Optus in Brisbane. 
Also, I looked up the peak times, it says 12am to 12pm for peak data and 12pm to 12am for off peak. But this is for their mobile service so it might not be applicable.

Do you have any background applications that could be taking up bandwidth, such as Steam, Skype or an internet browser (they still take bandwidth even if they're not loading anything)? If so, try closing them (best bet to do it from Task Manager).

Do you scan your computer for viruses/malware regularly?
nothing in the background using bandwidth, i turn off everything except LoL sometimes too. And I run bitdefender at all times pretty much.

I've noticed in my past few games that I've been getting consistent lag spikes, but only of recent. It may be the servers. Might want to just hold out instead of trying to fix it.

Alternatively, you can look through [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664) and troubleshoot everything it says to there. If you need any help with it, just ask.

Best of luck.
